list.name: Gateway Outages
list.rawQuery: SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, event_type as title, description as text FROM disruption_events WHERE event_type = 'gateway_unreachable'

list.name: Tower Handoffs
list.rawQuery: SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, event_type as title, description as text FROM disruption_events WHERE event_type LIKE 'tower_change%'

list.name: Signal Degradation
list.rawQuery: SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, event_type as title, description as text FROM disruption_events WHERE event_type LIKE 'signal_drop%'

list.name: Band Switches
list.rawQuery: SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, 'Band Change' as title, description as text FROM disruption_events WHERE event_type LIKE 'band_%'

panels.description: Total disruption events in selected time range

targets.rawSql: SELECT COUNT(*) as total FROM disruption_events

panels.title: Total Disruptions

panels.description: Number of gateway unreachable events

targets.rawSql: SELECT COUNT(*) as outages FROM disruption_events WHERE event_type = 'gateway_unreachable'

panels.title: Connection Drops

panels.description: Number of tower handoff events (5G and 4G)

targets.rawSql: SELECT COUNT(*) as handoffs FROM disruption_events WHERE event_type LIKE 'tower_change%'

panels.title: Tower Handoffs

panels.description: Number of significant signal degradation events

targets.rawSql: SELECT COUNT(*) as drops FROM disruption_events WHERE event_type LIKE 'signal_drop%'

panels.title: Signal Degradations

panels.description: Ping success rate from continuous monitoring

targets.rawSql: SELECT ROUND(SUM(CASE WHEN status = 'success' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) * 100.0 / NULLIF(COUNT(*), 0), 1) as success_rate FROM network_quality_results

panels.title: Ping Success Rate

panels.description: Failed pings in selected time range

targets.rawSql: SELECT COUNT(*) as failures FROM network_quality_results WHERE status != 'success'

panels.title: Failed Pings

panels.description: All disruption events over time with type breakdown

targets.rawSql: SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, event_type, COUNT(*) as count FROM disruption_events GROUP BY to_char(to_timestamp(timestamp_unix), 'YYYY-MM-DD HH24'), event_type, timestamp_unix ORDER BY time

panels.title: Disruption Events Over Time

panels.description: Ping success/failure timeline

targets.rawSql: SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, CASE WHEN status = 'success' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END as "Connectivity" FROM network_quality_results WHERE target_host = '8.8.8.8' ORDER BY timestamp_unix

panels.title: Connectivity Status Timeline

panels.description: Ping latency to each target over time

targets.rawSql: SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, ping_ms as "Google DNS" FROM network_quality_results WHERE target_host = '8.8.8.8' AND status = 'success' ORDER BY timestamp_unix
SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, ping_ms as "Cloudflare DNS" FROM network_quality_results WHERE target_host = '1.1.1.1' AND status = 'success' ORDER BY timestamp_unix
SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, ping_ms as "Carrier DNS" FROM network_quality_results WHERE target_host = '208.54.0.1' AND status = 'success' ORDER BY timestamp_unix

panels.title: Ping Latency Over Time

panels.description: Jitter (latency variance) over time - higher values indicate unstable connection

targets.rawSql: SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, jitter_ms as "Google DNS" FROM network_quality_results WHERE target_host = '8.8.8.8' ORDER BY timestamp_unix
SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, jitter_ms as "Cloudflare DNS" FROM network_quality_results WHERE target_host = '1.1.1.1' ORDER BY timestamp_unix
SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, jitter_ms as "Carrier DNS" FROM network_quality_results WHERE target_host = '208.54.0.1' ORDER BY timestamp_unix

panels.title: Jitter Over Time

panels.description: Packet loss percentage over time

targets.rawSql: SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, packet_loss_percent as "Google DNS" FROM network_quality_results WHERE target_host = '8.8.8.8' ORDER BY timestamp_unix
SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, packet_loss_percent as "Cloudflare DNS" FROM network_quality_results WHERE target_host = '1.1.1.1' ORDER BY timestamp_unix
SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, packet_loss_percent as "Carrier DNS" FROM network_quality_results WHERE target_host = '208.54.0.1' ORDER BY timestamp_unix

panels.title: Packet Loss Over Time

panels.description: Correlate ping latency with signal quality - do latency spikes match SINR drops?

targets.rawSql: SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, ping_ms as "Latency (ms)" FROM network_quality_results WHERE target_host = '8.8.8.8' AND status = 'success' ORDER BY timestamp_unix
SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, jitter_ms as "Jitter (ms)" FROM network_quality_results WHERE target_host = '8.8.8.8' ORDER BY timestamp_unix
SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, nr_sinr as "5G SINR (dB)" FROM signal_history WHERE nr_sinr IS NOT NULL ORDER BY timestamp_unix

panels.title: Latency vs Signal Quality Correlation

panels.description: 5G SINR (Signal to Interference Noise Ratio) over time

targets.rawSql: SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, nr_sinr as "5G SINR", lte_sinr as "4G SINR" FROM signal_history ORDER BY time

panels.title: Signal Quality (SINR)

panels.description: Reference Signal Received Power over time

targets.rawSql: SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, nr_rsrp as "5G RSRP", lte_rsrp as "4G RSRP" FROM signal_history ORDER BY time

panels.title: Signal Strength (RSRP)

panels.description: Physical Cell ID changes over time (tower handoffs)

targets.rawSql: SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, nr_cid as "5G Cell ID", lte_cid as "4G Cell ID" FROM signal_history ORDER BY time

panels.title: Cell ID Changes

panels.description: Tower ID changes (gNodeB for 5G, eNodeB for 4G)

targets.rawSql: SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, nr_gnb_id as "5G gNodeB", lte_enb_id as "4G eNodeB" FROM signal_history ORDER BY time

panels.title: Tower ID Changes

panels.description: Active frequency bands over time (5G NR and 4G LTE)

targets.rawSql: SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, CAST(regexp_replace(nr_bands::text, '[^0-9]', '', 'g') AS INTEGER) as "5G Band" FROM signal_history WHERE nr_bands IS NOT NULL AND nr_bands != '' AND nr_bands != '[]' ORDER BY time

SELECT timestamp_unix * 1000 as time, CAST(regexp_replace(lte_bands::text, '[^0-9]', '', 'g') AS INTEGER) as "4G Band" FROM signal_history WHERE lte_bands IS NOT NULL AND lte_bands != '' AND lte_bands != '[]' ORDER BY time

panels.title: Frequency Band Switches

panels.description: Recent disruption events with details

targets.rawSql: SELECT to_timestamp(timestamp_unix) AT TIME ZONE 'UTC' as time, event_type, description, duration_seconds FROM disruption_events ORDER BY timestamp_unix DESC LIMIT 100

panels.title: Recent Disruption Events

panels.description: Failed ping events with error details

targets.rawSql: SELECT to_timestamp(timestamp_unix) AT TIME ZONE 'UTC' as time, target_host, status as error_type, ping_ms as latency_ms FROM network_quality_results WHERE status != 'success' ORDER BY timestamp_unix DESC LIMIT 100

panels.title: Failed Ping Events

panels.description: Gateway poll failures with error details

targets.rawSql: SELECT to_timestamp(timestamp_unix) AT TIME ZONE 'UTC' as time, event_type as error_type, severity as circuit_state, description as error_message FROM disruption_events WHERE event_type = 'gateway_unreachable' ORDER BY timestamp_unix DESC LIMIT 100

panels.title: Gateway Poll Failures

panels.description: Distribution of disruption event types

targets.rawSql: SELECT event_type, COUNT(*) as count FROM disruption_events GROUP BY event_type ORDER BY count DESC

panels.title: Disruption Types Distribution

panels.description: Disruption frequency by hour of day

targets.rawSql: SELECT EXTRACT(HOUR FROM to_timestamp(timestamp_unix))::INTEGER as hour, COUNT(*) as disruptions FROM disruption_events GROUP BY hour ORDER BY hour

panels.title: Disruptions by Hour of Day

panels.description: Error type distribution in gateway poll failures

targets.rawSql: SELECT COALESCE(event_type, 'unknown') as error_type, COUNT(*) as count FROM disruption_events GROUP BY event_type ORDER BY count DESC

panels.title: Disruption Event Types

panels.description: Average gap between consecutive failures (helps identify periodic issues)

targets.rawSql: WITH failures AS (SELECT timestamp_unix, LAG(timestamp_unix) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp_unix) as prev_time FROM network_quality_results WHERE status != 'success') SELECT ROUND(AVG(timestamp_unix - prev_time)::numeric, 1) as avg_gap FROM failures WHERE prev_time IS NOT NULL AND (timestamp_unix - prev_time) < 3600

panels.title: Avg. Gap Between Failures

panels.description: Average ping latency for successful pings

targets.rawSql: SELECT ROUND(AVG(ping_ms)::numeric, 1) as avg_latency FROM network_quality_results WHERE status = 'success'

panels.title: Avg. Ping Latency

panels.description: Total estimated downtime based on failure durations

targets.rawSql: SELECT COALESCE(SUM(duration_seconds), 0) as total_downtime FROM disruption_events WHERE event_type = 'gateway_unreachable'

panels.title: Total Downtime
